Package biz.gabrys.lesscss.compiler2.filesystem

Interface FileSystem

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ClassPathFileSystem, FtpFileSystem, HttpFileSystem, LocalFileSystem
    public interface FileSystem
    Responsible for performing operations on paths pointing to files located on the file system. The files system is responsible for:
    • normalizing file paths - converting relative paths to absolute and canonical paths
    • expanding file paths redirections - resolving direct normalized file paths
    • checking if files specified by paths exist
    • fetching file data - reading data of the files stored in the file system
    Methods are always called in order:
    1. configure(Map) (only once after the file system has been created)
    2. isSupported(String)
    3. normalize(String)
    4. expandRedirection(String)
    5. exists(String) (sometimes it can be omitted)
    6. fetch(String)
    Since:
    2.0.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void configure​(Map<String,​String> parameters)
      Configures this file system.
      boolean exists​(String path)
      Tests whether a direct normalized file path point to an exiting file.
      String expandRedirection​(String path)
      Returns a direct normalized path to a resource.
      FileData fetch​(String path)
      Returns a data of the file specified by a path.

      Normalize a path.

    • Method Detail

      • configure

        void configure​(Map<String,​String> parameters)
        throws Exception
        Configures this file system. This method is called only once after the file system has been created.
        Parameters:
        parameters - the map with parameters (cannot be null).
        Throws:
        Exception - if any error occurs.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • isSupported

        boolean isSupported​(String path)
        Tests whether a file path is supported. This method should return true only when this file system allows to do all operations:
        • normalize file paths
        • expand file paths redirections
        • checking if files specified by paths exist
        • fetch files data
        Parameters:
        path - the path to verify (never null).
        Returns:
        true whether the file path is supported, otherwise false.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • normalize

        String normalize​(String path)
          throws Exception
        Normalize a path. A normalized path is an absolute path where at least:
        1. all "." segments are removed
        2. if ".." segment is preceded by a non-".." segment then both of these segments are removed.
        Examples:
        • C:\Users\less\style.less
        • /home/user/less/style.less
        • http://www.example.org/style.less
        Parameters:
        path - the path to normalize (never null).
        Returns:
        the normalized path (never null).
        Throws:
        Exception - if any error occurs.
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        isSupported(String)

      • expandRedirection

        String expandRedirection​(String path)
                  throws Exception
        Returns a direct normalized path to a resource. Example: if a path is equal to "http://example.org/style.less", but this URL forwards to "/static/style.less", then the method will return "http://example.org/static/style.less".
        Parameters:
        path - the normalized file path (never null).
        Returns:
        the direct normalized path to the resource (never null). If the path is already a direct path, it should return that path.
        Throws:
        Exception - if any error occurs.
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        normalize(String)

      • exists

        boolean exists​(String path)
        throws Exception
        Tests whether a direct normalized file path point to an exiting file.
        Parameters:
        path - the direct normalized file path (never null).
        Returns:
        true whether the direct file path point to an exiting file, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        Exception - if any error occurs.
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        expandRedirection(String)

      • fetch

        FileData fetch​(String path)
        throws Exception
        Returns a data of the file specified by a path.
        Parameters:
        path - the direct normalized file path (never null).
        Returns:
        the file data (never null).
        Throws:
        Exception - if any error occurs.
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        exists(String)
